intro: Claytonia grayana, commonly known as the gray's springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and appear in clusters at the base of the plant. Claytonia grayana is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in cool, humid climates.
